greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Smallest number that is n times the product of its digits or 0 if impossible.
link: David W. Wilson, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
example: a(4) = 384 because 4*(product of digits of 384) = 4*96 = 384, and no number smaller than 384 has this property.
mathematica: Do[k = n; If[Mod[n, 10] == 0, Print[0]; Continue[]]; While[Apply[Times, RealDigits[k][[1]]]*n != k, k += n]; Print[k], {n, 1, 14}]
results.author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 16 2000
ext: a(15) onwards from _David W. Wilson_, Jan 20 2016
